content.desc: While working at Censornet, I have been a core member of the R&D department, my role comprises of developing feature enhancements and updates to the multi-tenant software as a service (SaaS) customer platform, more specifically the backend REST APIs and microservices. The API communicates with multiple databases including our core PostreSQL database and third-party APIs and services. This involves working alongside the product manager, front end developers and QA engineers to produce tested, production code and working to tight deadlines. I have been developing and maintaining the backend since I started at the company and in 2020 became wholly responsible for all our PHP/Laravel projects, innovating the way the application is tested using tools like PHPUnit and continuous integration (CI).

Following my promotion in July 2021, I began improving our development lifecycle by integrating continuous deployment, which as a result would provide faster release cycles. This involved delving more into DevOps by learning Kubernetes and Helm.

We then embarked on updating the current portal and backend, using the existing platform as a blueprint. Along with the frontend lead, we made some key decisions including the use of TypeScript with the NestJS and React frameworks. Drawing on my experience using other frameworks like Laravel, I implemented multiple APIs, microservices and standalone apps using utilities like Jest to produce a well-tested backend platform. After providing foundations for other developers to learn and contribute to, I continued to implement larger features including using OIDC to connect to multiple identity providers, producing internal libraries for shared code and access controls.
Eager to expand my skills, I also started learning React and contributed to our internal component library and web application.

During my time at the company I gained a lot of experience creating high quality public and internal web portals as well as developing backend micro services and REST APIs. I have developed various systems while working at the company, including developing new products to sell to our customers and automating in house procedures. I was able to influence high level decisions such as programming techniques and tools and vastly expanding the company data centre infrastructure, showing I am motivated and proactive.

Additionally, I established my skills in DevOps and networking, which involves deploying and maintaining Linux servers. I have experience using the Linux command line as well as installing and configuring the operation system and the services. With my expanded role I became instrumental in ensuring connectivity, security and performance of these servers and the underlying data centres.

After being promoted to Software Team Lead, I implemented several improvements within the team, including implementing an improved software life cycle and assuring design principles such as SOLID and DRY are utilised. I was instrumental in designing the software architecture behind all software projects and draw on my knowledge in DevOps to plan and integrate solutions in to the wider system architecture. I additionally ensured software is prioritised and achieved at a high standard within tight deadlines. Another big part of the role is to mentor other team members and pass on my experience of delivering high quality solutions, while encouraging them to keep abreast of the latest best practices and technologies. My role gave me increased responsibility and management skills.

I also earned the role of Business Continuity Manager, which involved identifying risks, developing new policies and procedures and then implementing them across the entire company. This shows I have excellent organisational and communication skills. I gained the ISO 22301:2012 in Business Continuity accreditation for the company in May 2018.

The job at Axiell was part of my University placement year. They initially contracted me for 40 weeks which was then extended to 52 weeks after the company acknowledged the high quality work I was producing. My core duty was to create well designed maintainable interface using HTML and CSS. The project also required frequent validation, accessibility and usability testing, which I volunteered to take on and ultimately became my responsibility. Working for the company involved managing a large workload, good communication skills and team work in addition to excellent technical skills in HTML and CSS.

This job involved working to daily targets and working within regulations as well as correctly filling in paperwork and forms correctly and efficiently. The skills I obtained from this job were communication, team work and time management.
While still in full time education I worked as a shop assistant. The skills I gained working within this role was time management, communication, money handling, customer service and team work.
